questions.stem: For certain chemical reaction $$X \rightarrow Y$$, the rate of formation of product is plotted against time. Determine the correct statements: (A) Overall order of this reaction is one (B) Order of this reaction can’t be determined. (C) In region-I and III, the reaction is of first and zero order respectively (D) In region-II, the reaction is of first order (E) In region-II, the order of reaction is in the range of 0.1 to 0.9.

options.text: Option A: (A) Over all order of this reaction is one
Option B: (B) Order of this reaction can’t be determined
Option C: (C) In region-I and III, the reaction is of first and zero order respectively
Option D: (D) In region-II, the reaction is of first order

questions.explanation: The correct option is (B) since only statement (B) indicates that the order cannot be directly determined from graphical data unless other kinetic data is provided.
questions.tip_formula: Order cannot be practically determined from graphs without specific rate laws or data.
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The sum of bridging carbonyls in $$W(CO)_6$$ and $$Mn_2(CO)_{10}$$ is ________.
questions.explanation: In $$W(CO)_6$$ there are no bridging carbonyls and $$Mn_2(CO)_{10}$$ has no bridging COs, hence the sum is 0.
questions.tip_formula: Each metal-carbonyl complex needs to be evaluated individually for bridging COs.
questions.subject: Chemistry
